intro: Antirrhinum hispanicum var. ochroleucum, commonly known as the white-toothed snapdragon, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe. It belongs to the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pale yellow. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy surface. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade, making it a popular choice for garden cultivation. The flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
